title: Derby’s Take: How Fed Approaches Balance Sheet Could Affect Rate Increase Path
sub_head: Kansas City Fed leader says an aggressive runoff in the central bank’s balance sheet could allow it to raise rates less aggressively
body:
Unexpectedly strong hiring data released Friday reinvigorated expectations of Federal Reserve rate rises in a week where one of the central bank’s most historically hawkish members laid out a possible path for going lighter on the increases.
Speaking last week, Kansas City Fed leader Esther George joined with a range of her colleagues and agreed that with inflation running too high, the Fed needs to dial back on stimulus to help bring those price pressures back down toward the central bank’s 2% target.
